greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that the sum of the semiprime divisors equals n times the sum of the prime divisors, or 0 if no such k exists.
comment: Least k such that A076290(k) = n*A008472(k), or 0 if no such k exists. a(n) = n^2 if n is a prime number => A001248 is a subsequence.
link: Donovan Johnson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..1000
example: a(12) = 2541: The divisors of 2541 are {1, 3, 7, 11, 21, 33, 77, 121, 231, 363, 847, 2541}, so the sum of the semiprime divisors is 21 + 33 + 77 + 121 = 252, which is 12 times the sum of prime divisors 3 + 7 + 11 = 21.
maple: with(numtheory):for n from 2 to 43 do:ii:=0:for k from 2 to 700000 while(ii=0) do:x:=divisors(k):n1:=nops(x): y:=factorset(k):n2:=nops(y):s1:=0:s2:=0:for i from 1 to n1 do: if bigomega(x[i])=2 then s1:=s1+x[i]:else fi:od: s2:=sum('y[i]', 'i'=1..n2):if s1=n*s2 then ii:=1: printf ( "%d %d \n",n,k):else fi:od:od:
results.author: _Michel Lagneau_, Jul 18 2013
